intro: Potentilla mezzocoronae, commonly known as the Mezzocoronae cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of central Asia. It is a low-growing shrub with small, rounded leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh mountain environments. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and a high degree of frost resistance. It is often found in subalpine and alpine meadows at elevations above 2,500 meters.
